modName: Epic Music Overhaul - A Mixture of Stuff
summary: Tracks implemented into Skyrim, from games including World of Warcraft, Guild Wars 2, The Elder Scrolls Online, Diablo 3, Inquisition, the Witcher 3, and also TSFH and Audiomachine.
descriptionHtml:
Inb4, sorry if there's any grammatical mistake, GRAMMATIK MACHT FREI.


Tracks implemented into Skyrim using EMO, from:
World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor (No track from other expansions/vanilla)
Guild Wars 2
Diablo 3: Reaper of Souls (No track from Act I to Act IV)
Dragon Age: Inquisition
The Elder Scrolls Online
The Witcher 3
Oblivion (Only a few)
Morrowind (Only a few)
Two Steps From Hell
Audiomachine
Other tracks composed by Jeremy Soule, that I don't know which games or films or purpose were they composed for.

Requirement:
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/53888/?]EMO original mod (for its esp and scripts)[/url]
Everything that EMO requires

Compatibility:
Incompatible with any other mod that modifies soundtracks (except EMO base mod), that's for sure.


Sometimes there might be disparity between tracks in a zone, but I didn't find it disturbing or critical; these tracks actually immersed me into the game a lot, as I got quite bored of the vanilla tracks which mostly feature serenity. But EMO allows users to retain vanilla tracks (also to prevent them from playing).

One thing worth mentioning, is that I picked some sad-themed-yet-still-epic tracks (eg. Red Sorrow) for civil war, as I find this war pointless and foolish, only making innocent men die and bleed for it, while the Nords have to fight their own brethren and once-comrades; the war will still leave its mark on the history, that's why the tracks should be both sad and epic.

Also, besides the tracks that EMO offers spaces for, I also replaced the Level-Up, Absorb Dragon Soul, Learn Word of Power, Monumental Moments (Alduin's downfall, go to Skuldafn, which use level-up tracks) tracks with "new" tracks from vanilla and ESO tracks edited by myself. If you don't want them, simply remove every file except those in the EMO folder.

I did find some tracks as awesome as those in the package, but I think they're not suitable (eg. "cute and lovely" tracks, tracks by guitar) for a game like Skyrim, or any zone or moment in Skyrim, so I didn't add them.

I've checked all tracks and there should be no mismatch - at least for my taste. lol

Jeremy Soule is one of the best modern musicians, without a doubt. He's capable in all criteria of music, and I adore most of his work (I don't like some due to my own taste, it's personal and has nothing to do with Jeremy's own talent).


[b][size=5]If there's any legitimacy problem, please inform. I don't want to be banned without knowing the problems and being given a chance to fix them.[/size][/b]

Credits:
Microsoft for Windows
Betheada for the game itself
Jeremy Soule for Vanilla Skyrim tracks and most of the new tracks in the package
Apollodown for EMO
JohnB for Skyrim Audio Converter
Aldmeri Dominion and its Archon(s) for giving me LOTS of inspiration when I decide what tracks should be put into where
Myself for finding, locating, renaming and turning the tracks
World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor
Guild Wars 2
Diablo 3: Reaper of Souls
Dragon Age: Inquisition
The Elder Scrolls Online
The Witcher 3
Oblivion
Morrowind
Two Steps From Hell
Audiomachine
author: MANY people
